mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Has received Ruellan and Company's previous letter; is not familiar with Mr. Silas Talbot and his sons; received a letter from Silas Talbot about his sons in the French Navy and the money he left for them in care of Monsieur La Forest; sent a letter to Havre to find out if the money had been sent there by La Forest but has not heard anything; explains that this is the reason for his delay in replying to Ruellan and Company's letter; believes that Ruellan and Company can most likely find out something in Havre; he has no authority in this matter and is about to leave for America anyway.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1789 April 23, Paris, [France], to Ruellan [and Company], [Havre, France].
